#Text=Kalema of Buganda
#Text=Rashid Kalema Muguluma was Kabaka of the Kingdom of Buganda , from 21 October 1888 until 5 October 1889 .
#Text=He was the 33rd Kabaka of Buganda .
#Text=Claim to the throne
#Text=Kalema Muguluma was the son of Kabaka Mukaabya Walugembe Muteesa I Kayiira , Kabaka of Buganda , who reigned between 1856 and 1884 .
#Text=His mother was Ndibuwakanyi , of the Mamba clan .
#Text=He was declared Kabaka by the Muslim forces that deposed his elder brother Kabaka Kiweewa Mutebi Nnyonyintono on 21 October 1888 .
#Text=He maintained his capital at Mengo Hill .
#Text=Married life
#Text=He is recorded to have married the following wives :
#Text=Nabikukuzi , daughter of Jjumba , of the Nkima clan
#Text=Sofia Kabakalongoosa , daughter of Kinyolo , of the Nkima clan
#Text=Nakibuuka , daughter of Mugema , of the Nkima clan
#Text=Zefiria Nnampa Nakibuuka , daughter of Bakkabulindi of the Ngeye clan
#Text=Nabibooge , daughter of Kibaya , of the Nsenene clan
#Text=Veneneka Nabiwemba , daughter of Wakooli , a Musoga , of the Ngabi clan
#Text=Njera Saabaddu , daughter of Gabunga , of the Mamba clan
#Text=Issue
#Text=His recorded children include :
#Text=Prince ( Omulangira ) Kiweewa Zzimbe , whose mother was Nabikukuzi
#Text=Prince ( Omulangira ) Edmond Alamanzaani Ndawula , whose mother was Zefiria Nnampa .
#Text=He died on July 1 , 1916
#Text=Prince ( Omulangira ) Yozefu Musanje Walugembe , MBE .
#Text=He was born on 31 August 1889 .
#Text=His mother was Nabibooge .
#Text=He was educated at Namilyango College .
#Text=In October 1914 , he was commissioned as a 2nd Lieutenant in the African Native Medical Corps .
#Text=In 1915 , he was promoted to lieutenant .
#Text=He served in the First World War from 1915 until 1919 .
#Text=He was decorated with the Member of the Order of the British Empire ( MBE ) , the 1915 Star and the British War and Allied Victory medals .
#Text=On 18 November 1907 , he married Sala Kiire , daughter of Chevalier Stanislas Mugwaanya , OBE , GCSG , at the White Fathers ' Mission , Nsambya .
#Text=Prince Musanje fathered two sons and one daughter : ( a ) Prince ( Omulangira ) Joseph Mukaabya ( b ) Prince ( Omulangira ) Daudi Kimera and ( c ) Princess ( Omumbejja ) Tereza Namukaabya .
#Text=Princess ( Omumbejja ) Yuniya Maliamu Kamuwanda , whose mother was Veneneka Nabiwemba .
#Text=Princess Kamuwanda was installed as Naalinnya to Kabaka Daudi Chwa II on August 14 , 1897 .
#Text=She received the Silver Jubilee medal in 1935 , the Coronation Medal in 1937 and the Papal medal " Pro Ecclesia et Pontifice " in 1951 .
#Text=She died on May 30 , 1951 .
#Text=Princess ( Omumbejja ) Besemerese Hana Dimbwe .
#Text=She was born in Kampala in 1887 .
#Text=Her mother was Sofia Kabak'alongoosa .
#Text=In September 1905 , she married , at Mbale , as his third wife , Semei Lwakirenzi Kakungulu , then Kabaka of Bukedi . [ 1 ]
#Text=His reign
#Text=The period from 1884 through 1897 witnessed tremendous strife in Buganda .
#Text=Sufficient Baganda had converted to one of the three major religions in the kingdom ; Catholicism , Protestantism or Islam .

#Text=As the ruling class in the kingdom attempted to adjust to the loss of absolute authority over their subjects ' lives to these new religions ; the kingdom was thrown into turmoil , rebellion , counter-rebellion and religious persecution .
#Text=Within a period of thirteen years from 1884 until 1897 , Buganda witnessed the change of leadership at Mengo , six times , which was unprecedented in the kingdom .
#Text=Various Kabaka 's took sides with one religion or the other , only to be deposed by the supporters of the religions they did not choose .
#Text=And the cycle repeated itself .
#Text=In October 1888 , the Muslim faction was dominant in Buganda .
#Text=All Christian missionaries were expelled , and Kabaka Kiweewa Mutebi Nnyonyintono was deposed .
#Text=Kabaka Kalema Muguluma , who had converted to Islam and taken on the name Rashid , was installed on the throne .
#Text=However , only one year later , he was forced to step down by the British imperial forces .
#Text=He was offered an ultimatum by the British : either convert to Christianity and retain the throne , or remain Muslim and lose the throne .
#Text=He evidently chose Islam and was deposed .
#Text=The final years
#Text=After his removal from the throne by the British , Kabaka Kalema went into exile in Bunyoro .
#Text=He died in exile from complications of smallpox in January 1891 .
#Text=At the time of his death , his age is estimated to have been in the mid-twenties .
#Text=His remains were repatriated and buried at Mmende in Busiro . [ 2 ]
#Text=Succession table
